title.native: 怪盗セイント・テール

description:
Meimi Haneoka, 14, is a normal girl during the daytime, but during the night, she assumes the "position" of Saint Tail, a modern-day Robin Hood who steals from thieves and gives items back to their original owners. She is aided by her friend, Seira Mimori, a nun-in-training, and she is chased by her classmate (and soon-to-be love interest), Daiki Asuka (often called "Asuka Jr.").

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Lisa e Seya - Un solo cuore per lo stesso segreto
จอมโจรสาวเซนต์เทล

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

node.description:
[Note](https://note.com/megu22/)

Megumi Tachikawa is a Japanese Mangaka. She made her debut in 1992 in the magazine Nakayoshi DX with the one-shot "16 sai no Tiara", for which she was awarded the 13rd Nakayoshi Prize for Young Authors.

__Birthplace:__ Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E5%B7%9D%E4%BF%8A%E9%81%93)

Toshimichi Ookawa is a screenwriter and film director.

He graduated from the Faculty of Law, Meiji University in 1980. Made his screenwriting debut on Taiyou ni Hoero, a long-running prime-time detective series. In anime he debuted as a screenwriter on [Cat's Eye](https://anilist.co/anime/2043/).

**Hayato Matsuo** is a Japanese arranger, composer, orchestrator and musician. Hayato is a composer, arranger and orchestrator for both the video game industry and the anime industry. He has worked on titles such as Front Mission 3, Final Fantasy XII, the Shenmue Series, and Magic Knight Rayearth. Inspired by his mother, who was a piano teacher, he graduated from the music composition department of Tokyo University of the Arts. While in college, he composed for the band G-Clef, and occasionally stood in for the members of the band. Upon graduating, he went to work under Sugiyama Kouichi, the composer of the popular Dragon Quest video game series, arranging his pieces for Dragon Quest anime shows and soundtracks. In 1991, Hayato began to work as a video game music composer himself, writing the score to Master of Monsters. Over the next few years, he worked as an independent composer on several games and anime series, including Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen. In 1995, he joined the independent music composition group Imagine. He has continued since then to compose and orchestrate works for over 20 games and anime shows, as well as the television show Kamen Rider 555, and a few pieces a part of original albums.

**Birth Name:** Noriko Kamachi (蒲池法子)
**Height:** 160 cm

Seiko Matsuda is a Japanese pop singer-songwriter, known for being one of the most popular Japanese idols of the 1980s. Due to her popularity in the 1980s and her long career, she has been dubbed the "Eternal Idol" by the Japanese media.
Joined Audio Planning U in 1982, where he studied under [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/).

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shichiro_kobayashi/)

A former art director and a guest professor at Kobe Design University.

Kobayashi graduated from Musashino Art University and first became an elementary school art teacher. It was only later that he joined the animation industry in 1964. He started quickly making a name for himself as a background artist and consequently established his own background art studio Kobayashi Production, in 1968. During this time thick poster paint was dominating the backgrounds in anime, but Kobayashi started a new style with much thinner painting and colored pencil strokes.

He has worked as an art director on over 100 titles and is one of the most distinguished art directors in the medium. Notable works include [Gamba no Bouken](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/), [Ie Naki Ko](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/), [Takarajima](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/), [Tenshi no Tamago](https://anilist.co/anime/885/), [Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/) and [Nodame Cantabile](https://anilist.co/anime/1698/).

Kobayashi retired from the industry in 2010, which was followed by his studio's closedown a year later.

In a 2015 [interview](https://youtu.be/V1tiKOsCz2M), Kobayashi talked about his life and passion in painting touring his atelier and showcasing his work.

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/日暮裕一)

Yuuichi Higurashi was a Japanese scriptwriter for TV dramas and animations.
